title: In New Zealand, the right poised to return to power under Christopher Luxon
description: After six years in power, Labour lost the general election on Saturday.

title: France lost to South Africa in Rugby World Cup quarter-finals
description: Title holders remain on course to retain the Rugby World Cup after a 29-28 win over hosts France on Sunday. South Africa will face England in next week's semi-finals.

title: Actress Suzanne Somers dies at 76
description: Somers appeared in many television shows in the 1970s, but her most famous part came with 'Three's Company.' She also played the mom in the long-running kids sitcom 'Step by Step'.

title: England puts an end to Fiji's Rugby World Cup run
description: The World Cup quarterfinals delivered another heart-stopper on Sunday as England held on in the face of a valiant fightback from the Flying Fijians to end the crowd-pleasing run of the tournament darlings by a tense 30-24.

title: Poland: Donald Tusk says opposition has enough votes to unseat the Law and Justice party
description: An exit poll suggested that three opposition parties have likely won 248 seats in the 460-seat lower house of parliament and the governing conservative nationalist party, 200 seats. The state electoral commission expects to have final results by Tuesday.

title: The Israeli army changes the rules of its war against Hamas
description: The October 7 attack altered the status quo in which the Jewish State was attempting to manage the conflict with Gaza. The aims, and the rules, of its operation have changed.

title: Australia rejects historic constitutional change that would enshrine Indigenous Voice in parliament
description: The referendum that was to give constitutional recognition to Indigenous peoples was rejected on Saturday by 60% of voters.

title: Director Wim Wenders: 'I'm a German romantic, America taught me that'
description: 'I wouldn't be where I am today if...' Every week, Le Monde interviews a celebrity about a decisive moment in their life. The filmmaker, born in August 1945 in Germany, looks back on his childhood in a country in ruins.

title: Azerbaijan leader raises national flag in Karabakh capital
description: Baku published images of President Ilham Aliyev touring Nagorno-Karabakh after his forces swept through the mountainous region that ended three decades of Armenian separatist rule.

title: Arras attack: How Caucasus-born jihad developed in France
description: Several individuals involved in terrorist acts and attacks in France recently are of Chechen origin. Mohammed M., who killed a teacher in Arras on Friday, arrived in France in 2008 with his family from the Russian region of Inushetia.

title: 'You have the best philosophical conversations with props like Cyril Baille'
description: Every week during the Rugby World Cup, Aristide Barraud gives a personal look, in text and pictures, at the French national team.

title: Migration: The Aegean sea paradox
description: Every day in the Aegean Sea, the Turkish coastguard rescues dozens of migrant boats turned away – often by gangs formed of other migrants – as they approach the Greek island of Lesbos.

title: Gaza: The making of a ticking time bomb
description: Since the creation of the state of Israel, Gaza has been a bastion of Palestinian resistance. Under blockade since 2007 after Hamas won legislative elections, the enclave turned into a volcano. On October 7, it erupted.

title: Antoine Dupont, France's star player, returns to the Rugby World Cup
description: The French team captain, who suffered an injury to the face during a match against Namibia on September 21, is back for the quarter-finals against South Africa at the Stade de France on Sunday.

title: Powerful earthquake hits west Afghanistan a week after devastating quakes in same region
description: Another earthquake hit Herat province on Sunday, a week after thousands of people died in a series of earthquakes.

title: Israeli army closes area near Lebanon border to civilians
description: Israel says one person was killed in fire from Lebanon. Hezbollah claimed responsibility for the strikes.

title: Poland voting in 'most important' elections since the fall of Communism
description: Sunday's Parliamentary elections will decide whether conservative national party Law and Justice (PiS) stays in power for a third term. Rule of law and a future of authoritarianism in the country are at stake.

title: New Zealand topple Ireland in epic Rugby World Cup quarter-final
description: They were tipped to lose, but resisted the Irish. On Saturday at the Stade de France, New Zealanders snatched a place in the World Cup semi-finals, only the ninth time in their history.

title: Poland votes in election that will decide future for ruling party
description: Poles vote in what many consider to be the most important election since 1989. It will decide whether the right-wing Law and Justice party stays in power.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Confusion and powerlessness at UN Security Council
description: The UN Security Council has been unable to agree on a statement, as Israel heavily strikes the Gaza Strip and calls on 1.1 million Palestinian civilians to evacuate. Russia is trying to take advantage of the divisions.

title: Japanese government seeks to dissolve Unification Church
description: The assassination of former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe in 2022 revealed ties between elected members of the ruling Liberal Democratic Party and the church.

title: 'Carrie' Actress Piper Laurie dies at 91
description: The actress, three-time Academy Award nominee for 'The Hustler,' 'Carrie' and 'Children of a Lesser God,' died early Saturday in her home in Los Angeles.

title: In India, the semantic and ideological battle to rename the country
description: Behind the battle over the name 'Bharat' lies the ruling nationalists' much further-reaching plan to transform India into a Hindu nation, rather than a secular, multi-faith state.
